Item_Cook_G_12_Caption: The tantalizing aroma of mushrooms and butter beckons you to the table.
Item_Cook_G_13_Caption: The sweetness of the ingredients gives this risotto a mild flavor.
Item_Cook_G_14_Caption: The rice used in this rich risotto permeates the light flavor of the salmon.
Item_Cook_G_15_Caption: The sweet and spicy meat stuffed into these rice balls will keep you full for some time.
Item_Cook_G_16_Caption: The fluffy crab legs pair perfectly with the rice for a truly scrumptious dish.
Item_Cook_G_17_Caption: An everyday staple of seaside villages, the secret to its delicious flavor lies in crab fat.
Item_Cook_H_01_Caption: Rich butter flanks fresh seafood. The secret ingredient is lots and lots of love.
Item_Cook_H_02_Caption: Popular among residents of coastal regions, this juicy porgy is a delish dish.
Item_Cook_H_03_Caption: The crispy skin of this fried hearty salmon puts its texture in a class all its own.
Item_Cook_I_01_Caption: A celebration isn't a celebration until this fruit-filled crust hits the table!
Item_Cook_I_02_Caption: The crispy, flaky pie crust and sweet apples are a match made in heaven.
Item_Cook_I_03_Caption: You'll know this simple dessert is done baking when it smells just delightful.
Item_Cook_I_04_Caption: You'll need an extra napkin to deal with this juicy pie of perfectly baked minced meat.
Item_Cook_I_05_Caption: Even those who don't like carrots tend to enjoy the mild sweetness of this cake.
Item_Cook_I_06_Caption: The intense sweetness of pumpkins makes this dessert popular among children.
Item_Cook_I_07_Caption: The apple's sweetness has been enhanced by smothering it with butter and baking it.
Item_Cook_I_08_Caption: A juicy sweet-and-sour dish combining newly ripened apples with honey.
Item_Cook_I_09_Caption: A dish that combines the thick sweetness of honey with the acidity of sour fruits.
Item_Cook_I_10_Caption: The simplicity of this dish lets the flavor of its ingredients shine.
Item_Cook_I_11_Caption: Sweet, tart wildberries are folded into thin, springy dough to make this dessert.
Item_Cook_I_12_Caption: Forest nuts give this cake a pleasant texture and a simple, understated sweetness.
Item_Cook_I_13_Caption: Children love fried mighty bananas. The trick is frying them over very high heat.
Item_Cook_I_14_Caption: Made by cooking eggs and milk in a special mold, its soft texture melts in your mouth.
Item_Cook_I_15_Caption: A mainstay in any fisherman's home, the crisp crust pairs well with the fishy flavor.
Item_Cook_I_16_Caption: A natural sweet, brimming with nutrition and made by stewing fresh honey.
Item_Cook_I_17_Caption: Honey has been drizzled over thin crepes to bring out their natural sweetness and flavor.
Item_Cook_J_01_Caption: A favorite all over Hyrule, this simple dish has a flavor you just won't get tired of.
Item_Cook_J_02_Caption: This healthy curry is popular for its mild flavor and moderate spiciness.
Item_Cook_J_03_Caption: This dish brims with treasures from the sea. Its spice packs a kick, so it's not for kids.
Item_Cook_J_04_Caption: The savory meat pairs well with the aroma of spice in this common curry.
Item_Cook_J_05_Caption: The secret to this curry's flavor is taking it off the heat while you add the spices.
Item_Cook_J_06_Caption: The heat from the spice allows you to enjoy the large portion of the meat's savoriness.
Item_Cook_J_07_Caption: The high-quality meat in this curry has given it a deeper taste than most other curries.
Item_Cook_J_08_Caption: Once served in Hyrule Castle, the poultry used in this dish is of immensely high quality.
Item_Cook_J_09_Caption: The high-quality meat used in this prized dish satisfies meat and curry lovers alike.
Item_Cook_K_01_Caption: The hearty meat in this mainstay dish leaves bellies satisfied all throughout Hyrule.
Item_Cook_K_02_Caption: Letting the large portions of choice cuts of meat simmer brought out their savoriness.
Item_Cook_K_03_Caption: Simply simmer a pumpkin to make this dish. A favorite in Kakariko Village.
Item_Cook_K_04_Caption: The pleasant texture and flavor of snails combine with butter and milk in a rich soup.
Item_Cook_K_05_Caption: The meat has simmered for so long it melts in your mouth. A true bucket-list meal!
Item_Cook_K_06_Caption: This creamy mushroom-and-vegetable soup is thick and flavorful.
Item_Cook_K_07_Caption: Made by simmering vegetables in milk, this healthy dish is as simple as its ingredients.
Item_Cook_K_08_Caption: This simple stew sat simmering for a long time to bring out the sweetness of the carrots.
Item_Cook_K_09_Caption: Make this by heating up some milk. Drink it before bed to ensure a good night's sleep.
Item_Cook_L_01_Caption: Meat and seafood simmered in monster extract. A savory dish despite its ingredients.
Item_Cook_L_02_Caption: Using monster extract as a base, this soup's distinct gaminess is either loved or hated.
Item_Cook_L_03_Caption: It's said that once you have a taste of this cake, you'll never forget its sweetness.
Item_Cook_L_04_Caption: Rice balls flavored with monster extract. Their unique aroma is not for everyone.
Item_Cook_L_05_Caption: This unusual take on curry uses monster extract and doesn't rely only on spices.
Item_Cook_M_01_Caption: Made with wheat from the Tabantha region, this soft, springy bread smells just heavenly.
Item_Cook_N_01_Caption: No fisherman's birthday bash would be complete without this top-shelf seafood dish.
Item_Cook_N_02_Caption: Making ample use of fruits found all over Hyrule, this cake is a must for celebrations.
Item_Cook_N_03_Caption: This home-style dish mixes fluffy eggs with chopped vegetables for nutritional balance.
Item_Cook_N_04_Caption: The fluffy texture of this omelet is one of the great joys of this dish, as well as life.
Item_Cook_O_01_Caption: It's too gross to even look at. A bizarre smell issues forth from this heap. Eating it won't hurt you though...probably.
Item_Cook_O_02_Caption: A dish gone awry after adding the wrong ingredient. Chewing your way through this won't be fun, but it will fill you up when you're between a rock and a hard place.
Item_Cook_P_01_Caption: The fragrant aroma of this sautéed spice and mushroom dish makes your mouth water.
Item_Cook_P_02_Caption: A fragrant mixture of herbs and spices. It's easily recognized by its unique aroma.
Item_Cook_P_03_Caption: A special Goron spice covers up the scent of the meat, allowing its flavor to shine.
Item_Cook_P_04_Caption: The simple preparation of this steak dish belies its complex taste profile.
Item_Cook_P_05_Caption: The rich aroma and juicy texture of this high- quality meat puts it in a league of its own.
Item_Cook_Q_01_Caption: When simmered until tender, nutritious tomatoes can give this dish a sour kick.
Item_Cook_Q_02_Caption: A colorful dish, a bounty of fruit simmered with fresh tomatoes.
Item_Cook_Q_03_Caption: Tomato cooked while wrapped in a leaf. The heat brings out its medicinal effect.
Item_Cook_Q_04_Caption: A dish of fragrant mushrooms simmered with tomato. Healthy and rich in fiber.
Item_Cook_Q_05_Caption: Seafood simmered with tomato. Full of intense flavor.
Item_Cook_Q_06_Caption: A wild dish of a whole stambulb roasted with its skin on. Sweet and tasty.
Item_Cook_Q_07_Caption: A simple dish of stambulb sautéed with goat butter. Sweet with a hint of spice.
Item_Cook_Q_08_Caption: Hylian rice fried up with meat in high-quality oil. Each bite is packed with toasty flavor.
Item_Cook_Q_09_Caption: A rich, moist, flavorful dessert with a Hateno cheese base.
Item_Cook_Q_10_Caption: Rich risotto made with fish or mushroom mixed with Hylian rice and Hateno cheese.
Item_Cook_R_01_Caption: A satisfying dish with Hateno cheese poured over a tasty omelet.
Item_Cook_R_02_Caption: Porridge made of easy-to-digest vegetables, fresh milk, and Hylian rice. An uplifting dish.
Item_Cook_R_03_Caption: A popular fruit juice in Gerudo Town. Its tropical flavor will cheer you right up.
Item_Cook_R_04_Caption: A pizza made with fresh Hylian tomato. Slices of melty Hateno cheese make it irresistible.
Item_Cook_R_05_Caption: A tasty dish of seafood and stambulb cooked in oil. Its aroma will whet your appetite.
Item_Cook_R_06_Caption: A drumstick fried in high-quality oil. It's full of out-of-this-world flavor.
Item_Cook_R_07_Caption: A deep-fried bird thigh so good, it's hard to take bites that aren't too big!
Item_Cook_R_08_Caption: A deep-fried whole bird of the highest grade. It's a standard item in any celebratory feast.
Item_Cook_R_09_Caption: Is there anything better than a simple slice of bread baked with Hateno cheese on top?
Item_Cook_R_10_Caption: Fresh seafood delightfully accented with a generous serving of Hateno cheese.
Item_Cook_S_01_Caption: Curry with plenty of Hateno cheese, which balances the spiciness and urges seconds.
Item_Cook_S_02_Caption: A high-calorie dish with meat and plenty of cheese. A great dish for very hungry diners.
Item_Cook_S_03_Caption: This bowl is loaded with high-quality meat and cheese. A satisfying meal for any big eater.
Item_Cook_S_04_Caption: Top-quality meat and cheese piled high. But can it satisfy the ultimate gourmand?
Item_Cook_S_05_Caption: A daring dish of dark clump stewed with meat and fish. What a surprise!
Item_Cook_S_06_Caption: A bold rice ball made with dark clump and Hylian rice. Its flavor is unforgettable!
Item_Cook_S_07_Caption: A gooey soup built on stewed dark clump. One could get lost in its swirls and flavors.
Item_Cook_S_08_Caption: A hard-hitting curry with a dark-clump base, whose flavor is hard to hide.
Item_Cook_S_09_Caption: An unusual dark-clump cake with a unique flavor that may be impossible to fully describe.
Item_Cook_S_10_Caption: A simple dish of Hylian tomato topped with delicious Hateno cheese. A perfect snack.
Item_Enemy_01_Caption: It's worn down and not very sharp, but it's still pretty hard. Cook it with a critter to make an elixir, or attach it to an arrow to increase its attack power.
Item_Enemy_02_Caption: A rare material obtained by defeating a Bokoblin. It convulses on its own every now and then, which is really creepy, but perhaps it has a use.
Item_Enemy_04_Caption: This talon once grew from the elbow of a Lizalfos. Its aerodynamic shape increases attack power when attached to arrows. Stew it with critters to make elixirs.
Item_Enemy_05_Caption: A highly flexible, stretchable tail. Fuse it with a weapon to add a lashing, whiplike quality to attacks.
Item_Enemy_07_Caption: A hard, sharp fang obtained from a Moblin. Stew it with a critter to make an elixir, or attach it to an arrow to increase its attack power.
Item_Enemy_08_Caption: This prized ingredient can be obtained from Moblins. Its odor is too pungent for normal food preparation, but stew it with some critters to make elixirs.
Item_Enemy_100_Caption: An elongated hammer-shaped horn with a hard, flat front. Attach to a weapon to increase attack power, or cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_101_Caption: A hammer-shaped horn with spiky bumps. Attach it to a weapon to moderately increase its attack power, or cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_102_Caption: This large, heavy horn has slowly grown into its present hammer-like shape. Attach it to a weapon to greatly increase its attack power, or cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_103_Caption: A curved horn with an extremely hard tip. Attach it to a weapon to vastly increase its attack power, or cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_104_Caption: A talon obtained from a Horriblin. Attach it to an arrow to increase its attack power, or stew it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_105_Caption: Rare material dropped by a Horriblin. It's very bitter and unsuitable for cooking, but it makes an effective elixir when cooked with a critter.
Item_Enemy_106_Caption: A thin, sharp, knife-like horn. Attach it to a weapon to increase its attack power, or cook it with a critter to brew an elixir.
Item_Enemy_107_Caption: A very long, sword-like horn. Attach it to a weapon to moderately increase its attack power, or cook it with a critter to brew an elixir.
Item_Enemy_108_Caption: A blade-like, serrated horn. Attach it to a weapon to greatly increase its attack power, or cook it with a critter to brew an elixir.
Item_Enemy_109_Caption: A sickle-shaped horn that looks like it could slice anything it touches. Attach it to a weapon to vastly increase its attack power, or cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_114_Caption: A highly flexible, stretchable tail. Fuse it with a weapon to add a lashing, whiplike quality to attacks, or cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_115_Caption: A highly flexible, stretchable tail. Fuse it with a weapon to add a lashing, whiplike quality to attacks, or cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_116_Caption: A tough, flexible, stretchable tail. Fuse it with a weapon to add a lashing, whiplike quality to attacks.
Item_Enemy_117_Caption: Fire Keese eyeballs are imbued with heat and are useful in making elixirs. Attach one to an arrow to grant a homing quality to the arrow.
Item_Enemy_118_Caption: Electric Keese eyeballs are imbued with electric power and are useful in making elixirs. Attach one to an arrow to grant a homing quality to the arrow.
Item_Enemy_119_Caption: Ice Keese eyeballs are imbued with freezing power and are useful in making elixirs. Attach one to an arrow to grant a homing quality to the arrow.
Item_Enemy_121_Caption: The dried guts of a defeated Gibdo. It's said they're effective, vitality-rich ingredients that are useful in elixirs.
Item_Enemy_123_Caption: A wing that catches the light. Arrows and thrown weapons fly farther with this item attached. Cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_124_Caption: A large, wide Aerocuda wing. Arrows and thrown weapons fly farther with this item attached, even in a slight wind.
Item_Enemy_13_Caption: This rare ingredient can be obtained only from a Lynel. It's very heavy and can be brewed with a critter for an elixir. Attached to an arrow, it increases the arrow's attack power.
Item_Enemy_130_Caption: A material used as a power source for constructs and other devices. Its strange light seems to reveal potent energy inside.
Item_Enemy_130_Caption_HasBattery: A material used as a power source for constructs and other devices. Use it to recover a small amount of power for a Zonai Energy Cell.
Item_Enemy_130_Caption_UseRecycleBox: A material used as a power source for constructs and other devices. Put it in a Zonai device dispenser, or use it to recover a small amount of power for a Zonai Energy Cell.
Item_Enemy_131_Caption: A large Zonai charge found near ruins. It seems as though it's bursting with energy because of the strangely powerful light coming from it.
Item_Enemy_131_Caption_HasBattery: A Zonai charge with a massive amount of energy stored within. Applied to a Zonai Energy Cell, it can temporarily prevent the cell from losing power.
Item_Enemy_131_Caption_UseRecycleBox: A Zonai charge with massive energy stored within. Put it in a Zonai device dispenser, or use it to temporarily prevent a Zonai Energy Cell from losing power.
Item_Enemy_132_Caption: An axe-shaped horn with a band to identify it as belonging to a leader. Attach it to a weapon to moderately increase attack power, or cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_133_Caption: A double-edged, axe-shaped horn with two leader bands. Attach it to a weapon to greatly increase attack power, or cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_134_Caption: A circular, serrated horn. The neatly tied strap contains arcane power. Attach it to a weapon to vastly increase attack power, or cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_135_Caption: A large fang dropped by a Boss Bokoblin. Attach it to an arrow to increase attack power, or stew it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_136_Caption: A rare material dropped by a Boss Bokoblin. It moves constantly and looks grotesque. Toss into a stew with some critters to create elixirs.
Item_Enemy_14_Caption: This highly sought-after ingredient can only be obtained from a Lynel. It pulses with the vitality of a Lynel, a strength that makes it invaluable as an ingredient for elixirs.
Item_Enemy_142_Caption: A horn wrapped in spiked wood. Attach it to a weapon to increase attack power, or cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_143_Caption: This mean-looking horn is wrapped in hard chains. Attach it to a weapon to moderately increase attack power, or cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_144_Caption: A horn wrapped in dangerous debris. It's easy to work with and greatly increases the attack power of a weapon when attached. Cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_148_Caption: This blade-like Lynel horn is extremely sharp. It increases a weapon's attack power when attached. Cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_149_Caption: The sharp, blade-like horn of a Blue-Maned Lynel. Attach it to a weapon to moderately increase its attack power. Cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_15_Caption: A jiggly substance that normally comes from a Fire Chuchu. It consistently gives off heat. If struck, it will explode in a ball of flame.
Item_Enemy_150_Caption: This blade-like horn of a White-Maned Lynel can slash through just about anything. Attach it to a weapon to greatly increase attack power. Cook with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_151_Caption: This piercing horn is sharpened to a point for maximum poking. Attach it to a weapon to vastly increase its attack power. Cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_153_Caption: A crown-like, fire-imbued horn of a Gleeok. Attach it to a weapon to vastly increase its attack power. Cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_154_Caption: A crown-like, frost-imbued horn of a Gleeok. Attach it to a weapon to vastly increase its attack power. Cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_155_Caption: A crown-like, lightning-imbued horn of a Gleeok. Attach it to a weapon to vastly increase its attack power. Cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_156_Caption: This aerodynamic wing segment from a Gleeok is thin and light but extremely sturdy. Arrows and thrown weapons fly farther with this item attached.
Item_Enemy_157_Caption: A rare and precious, albeit creepy, material that pulses even after its former owner has been vanquished. Cook it with a critter to make a powerful elixir.
Item_Enemy_158_Caption: A precious scale that fell from the Light Dragon. It's faintly warm and has an oddly familiar, mysterious power that heals when attached to a weapon.
Item_Enemy_159_Caption: A precious talon that fell from the Light Dragon. It may look dangerous, but its real power is to heal when attached to a weapon.
Item_Enemy_16_Caption: A jiggly substance that came from an Electric Chuchu. Electricity pulses through its gelatinous mass. If struck, it will explode in a burst of electric current.
Item_Enemy_160_Caption: A shard that fell off from the Light Dragon's fang. It's smooth rather than rough, and it has a mysterious power to heal when attached to a weapon.
Item_Enemy_166_Caption: A blade-like horn from a Soldier Construct. It's very sharp, so handle with care.
Item_Enemy_167_Caption: A sharp, hooked horn dropped from a Soldier Construct II. It's well suited for slicing through small branches and plants. Attach it to a weapon to moderately increase attack power.
Item_Enemy_168_Caption: A serrated horn from a Soldier Construct III. Attach it to a weapon to greatly increase attack power. It can cut through plants and large trees.
Item_Enemy_169_Caption: A horn embedded with a sharp disk. The disk spins mysteriously and can slice through almost anything. Attach the horn to a weapon and vastly increase its attack power.
Item_Enemy_17_Caption: A jiggly substance that came from an Ice Chuchu. It's cool to the touch, and squeezing it seems to relieve stress. If struck, it will explode in a cold mist.
Item_Enemy_18_Caption: An aerodynamic material dropped by a defeated Keese. Arrows and thrown weapons fly farther with this item attached.
Item_Enemy_181_Caption: A strange round stone from a Like Like, made of crystallized inner fluids. It's a good ingredient for elixirs.
Item_Enemy_182_Caption: A stomach stone that persists even at high temperatures. It retains heat even outside the body of the creature that contained it, which makes it a useful elixir ingredient.
Item_Enemy_183_Caption: A stomach stone exposed to high voltage inside the body of a Shock Like. It maintains some charge even outside the creature. Cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_184_Caption: A stomach stone kept cold inside a very low- temperature body. It stays cold, even outside the body of the creature that contained it. Cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_186_Caption: A giant, ore-crunching Frox fang. Attach it to a weapon to moderately increase its attack power, or cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_187_Caption: A giant fang for excavating and crushing ores. Attach it to a weapon to greatly increase its attack power, or cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_188_Caption: A giant fang that can easily dig through solid bedrock. Attach it to a weapon to vastly increase its attack power, or cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_189_Caption: A flat, cracked fingernail. Attach it to an arrow to increase its attack power, or cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_19_Caption: These mysterious orbs scan their surroundings. Take advantage of their glaring awareness, and attach one to an arrow to grant a homing quality to the arrow.
Item_Enemy_190_Caption: Frox guts, still pulsing—possibly a vain attempt to circulate fluids through its former owner's large body. Cook it with a critter to make a powerful elixir.
Item_Enemy_191_Caption: A sharp, blade-like horn with a split tip that easily slices anything it touches. Attach it to a weapon to moderately increase attack power.
Item_Enemy_192_Caption: A sharp, blade-like horn with a complex tip. It looks almost decorative. Attach it to a weapon to greatly increase attack power.
Item_Enemy_193_Caption: A mean-looking, branching, blade-like horn. Its edges and tips are extremely sharp. Attach it to a weapon to vastly increase its attack power.
Item_Enemy_20_Caption: This can only be obtained from an Octorok- type enemy. It's too acidic for cooking, but it's highly valued as an ingredient for elixirs.
Item_Enemy_208_Caption: The impaled skulls should serve as a warning. But if you do obtain one, attach it to a weapon to vastly increase its attack power, or cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_21_Caption: This can only be obtained from an Octorok- type enemy. Its nature is to focus on a moving object. Attach one to an arrow to grant a homing quality to the arrow.
Item_Enemy_210_Caption: A hard jawbone. Its shape allows a Molduga some maneuverability in the sand. Attach it to a weapon to greatly increase its attack power. Cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_211_Caption: A sharp horn of the red spirit, Dinraal. It is said to be the crystallized power of fire itself. Attach the blade-shaped horn to a weapon to vastly increase attack power.
Item_Enemy_212_Caption: A sharp horn of the blue spirit, Naydra. It is said to be the crystallized power of ice itself. Attach the blade-shaped horn to a weapon to vastly increase attack power.
Item_Enemy_213_Caption: A sharp horn of the golden spirit, Farosh. It is said to be the crystallized power of electricity itself. Attach the blade-shaped horn to a weapon to vastly increase attack power.
Item_Enemy_214_Caption: A horn chipped off the Light Dragon. Its gentle glow has a calming effect, and it has a mysterious healing power when attached to a weapon.
Item_Enemy_215_Caption: A hard, curved Lynel horn. It isn't fully grown, but it can be attached to a weapon to increase its attack power, or cooked with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_216_Caption: Its ends are split apart, but this horn from a Blue-Maned Lynel is solid. Attach it to a weapon to moderately increase its attack power, or brew it into an elixir.
Item_Enemy_217_Caption: The claw-like ends of this White-Maned Lynel horn are all extremely hard. Attach to a weapon to greatly increase its attack power, or cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_218_Caption: This wickedly barbed Silver Lynel horn is as hard as a diamond. Attach to a weapon to vastly increase its attack power. It's also a precious elixir ingredient.
Item_Enemy_228_Caption: An incredibly hard stone mined from a spike on Dinraal's back. It is very destructive when fused to a weapon, and it also imbues that weapon with the power of flame.
Item_Enemy_229_Caption: An incredibly hard stone mined from a spike on Naydra's back. It is very destructive when fused to a weapon, and it also imbues that weapon with the power of ice.
Item_Enemy_230_Caption: An incredibly hard stone mined from a spike on Farosh's back. It is very destructive when fused to a weapon, and it also imbues that weapon with the power to shock.
Item_Enemy_231_Caption: An incredibly hard stone mined from a spike on the Light Dragon's back. It is very destructive when fused to a weapon, and it also imbues that weapon with healing power.
Item_Enemy_24_Caption: A sturdy, wing-like dorsal fin with a thick membrane that regulates wind resistance. Arrows and thrown weapons fly farther with this item attached. It also works well in elixirs.
Item_Enemy_25_Caption: A giant organ obtained from a Molduga. This invaluable ingredient is hard to come by, and its use is shrouded in mystery.
Item_Enemy_32_Caption: As tough as plate armor, this item increases an arrow's attack power when attached to it. Cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_33_Caption: This Hinox tooth is almost unbelievably big. Attach it to an arrowhead to increase its attack power, or brew it into an elixir.
Item_Enemy_34_Caption: A giant, smelly Hinox organ of unknown function. Upon close inspection, it appears to be quivering. It can be used to make an elixir, but some say it has other uses as well.
Item_Enemy_38_Caption: This precious scale contains a massive amount of heat. Attach it to a weapon to greatly increase its attack power. It can be cooked, but eating it seems like a waste.
Item_Enemy_39_Caption: This valuable claw is said to have once been covered in flames. Attach it to a weapon to greatly increase its attack power. It can also be cooked or sold.
Item_Enemy_40_Caption: A gelatinous substance that came from a Chuchu. It's unusable in this state, but applying a bit of elemental stimulation will change its form.
Item_Enemy_41_Caption: A tail that has stored up some heat from a scorching-hot environment. Fuse it with a weapon to add a lashing, whiplike quality to attacks, or cook it into an elixir.
Item_Enemy_42_Caption: A tail that's been exposed to the cold in an extremely frigid environment. Fuse it with a weapon to add a lashing, whiplike quality to attacks, or cook it into an elixir.
Item_Enemy_43_Caption: A tail that's been exposed to electricity. Fuse it with a weapon to add a lashing, whiplike quality to attacks, or cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_44_Caption: A rare Fire Keese wing. It's not usually on fire, but it does produce a powerful blaze when stimulated.
Item_Enemy_45_Caption: A rare Electric Keese wing. It's electrically charged and will shock everything around it when stimulated.
Item_Enemy_46_Caption: A rare Ice Keese wing. Don't let its pretty, frozen surface fool you. It blasts out a dangerous, freezing frost when stimulated.
Item_Enemy_47_Caption: An incredibly hard piece of a fang from Dinraal. Attach it to a weapon to greatly increase its attack power. It can also be cooked into a meal.
Item_Enemy_49_Caption: This precious scale contains supercooled air inside. Attach it to a weapon to greatly increase its attack power. It can be cooked, but just eating it seems like a waste.
Item_Enemy_50_Caption: This valuable claw was once nearly frozen. Attach it to a weapon to greatly increase its attack power. It can be cooked or sold for some rupees.
Item_Enemy_51_Caption: A piece that chipped off one of Naydra's  fangs. It's much harder than any metal. Attach it to a weapon to greatly increase its attack power, or cook it into a meal.
Item_Enemy_53_Caption: This precious scale is constantly charged with powerful electricity. Attach it to a weapon to greatly increase its attack power. Cooking it is possible but probably wasteful.
Item_Enemy_54_Caption: A valuable claw that once produced lightning. Attach it to a weapon to greatly increase its attack power. It can also be cooked or sold for rupees.
Item_Enemy_55_Caption: An extremely hard chip of one of Farosh's fangs. Attach it to a weapon to greatly increase its attack power. It can also be used in cooking.
Item_Enemy_57_Caption: This inflatable Octorok organ has a lot of lift, so attach it to items you want to see float. An arrow can serve as a good way to stick one to a distant object.
Item_Enemy_58_Caption: A horn that glows red with the power of fire. Cook it with a critter to make an elixir. The right combination could draw out the blazing power contained within.
Item_Enemy_59_Caption: The freezing power embedded in this horn's crystal tip can be used to your advantage if you know how. Otherwise, cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_60_Caption: A horn charged with as much electricity as a bolt of lightning. Cook it with a critter to make an elixir. It will discharge electricity when stimulated.
Item_Enemy_64_Caption: The band on this sword-shaped horn shows that it belonged to a leader. Attach it to a weapon to increase its attack power, or cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_66_Caption: This eyeball is constantly trying to focus on its targets. Cook it with a critter to make an elixir, or attach it to an arrow to grant a homing quality to the arrow.
Item_Enemy_67_Caption: This wavy, double-edged, blade-like horn is formidable when it comes to slashing. Attach it to a weapon to increase attack power.
Item_Enemy_69_Caption: A creepy bone with multiple sharp tips. Attach it to a weapon to greatly increase its attack power. It tends to break easily due to its odd shape.
Item_Enemy_77_Caption: A sharp horn with multiple barbs. Attach it to a weapon to increase its attack power, or cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_78_Caption: A two-pronged horn with sharp edges and tips. Attach it to a weapon to moderately increase its attack power, or brew it into an elixir.
Item_Enemy_79_Caption: A vicious, three-pronged horn. Attach it to a weapon to greatly increase its attack power, or cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_80_Caption: A large, blade-like horn with a unique flourish on the tip. It's sharper than it looks. Attach it to a weapon to vastly increase attack power, or cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_89_Caption: A hard horn that resulted from a skull mutation. Attach it to a weapon to increase its attack power, or cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_90_Caption: A large, curved horn with two extremely hard tips. Attach it to a weapon to moderately increase its attack power, or cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_91_Caption: A hefty horn with multiple tough barbs.  Attach it to a weapon to greatly increase its attack power, or cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_92_Caption: A nasty-looking, rock-hard horn. Attach it to a weapon to vastly increase its attack power, or cook it with a critter to make an elixir.
Item_FishGet_A_Caption: An ordinary fish that hasn't changed for ages. It can be eaten raw, but cooking it amplifies its healing benefits.
Item_FishGet_AA_Caption: A lively fish that hasn't changed much since ancient times. Its nutritious meat can restore a bit of health.
Item_FishGet_AC_Caption: A luminous fish that lives in dark caves. When consumed, its light enzyme can make one's body glow.
Item_FishGet_B_Caption: This large fish lives near the water's edge. Its sizable body can store a lot of nutrients. When used in cooking, it'll restore all your hearts and increase your maximum hearts.
Item_FishGet_C_Caption: This blue trout prefers cold bodies of water. Its skin contains enzymes that keep its body cool, and when cooked into a dish, it will temporarily boost your heat resistance.
Item_FishGet_D_Caption: This trout makes its home in the freshwater lakes. Its scales have an insulating compound that, when cooked into a dish, offers resistance to electricity.
Item_FishGet_E_Caption: This freshwater fish lives alongside its less mighty carp ilk. A compound in its liver promotes muscle growth. Dishes cooked with it will temporarily increase your attack power.
Item_FishGet_F_Caption: This ocean-dwelling fish comes with one rude attitude. The compounds in its flesh elevate your competitive spirit when it's cooked into a dish, thus increasing your attack power.
Item_FishGet_G_Caption: This porgy's body is covered in armor-hard scales. The compounds in its scales, when cooked into a dish, fortify your bones and temporarily boost your defense.
Item_FishGet_H_Caption: Calcium deposits in the scales of this ancient fish make them as hard as armor. Cooking it into a dish will fortify your bones, temporarily increasing your defense.
Item_FishGet_I_Caption: This fish makes its home in cold water, giving it extra layers of fat. It'll restore all your hearts and temporarily increase your maximum hearts when used in cooking.
Item_FishGet_J_Caption: This red trout prefers warm bodies of water. It has a special organ specifically for storing heat. When cooked into a dish, it temporarily boosts your resistance to the cold.
Item_FishGet_L_Caption: This Hyrule bass got to be the biggest fish by never getting caught (until now). Its long life results in a cooked dish that will restore a lot of stamina.
Item_FishGet_M_Caption: This large, glow-in-the-dark snail lives in fresh water. When cooked into a dish, it heightens your senses so you can move about silently.
Item_FishGet_X_Caption: Consuming the bioluminescent compound that makes this fish glow in the dark will increase concentration. Dishes cooked with it will suppress noise when consumed.
Item_FishGet_Z_Caption: This wild armored carp has been bred into a prizewinning fish. Its beautifully colored markings do not occur in nature. It offers no special effects when cooked.
Item_Fruit_A_Caption: A common fruit eaten by people since ancient times. Eat it fresh, or cook it to increase its effect.
Item_Fruit_B_Caption: A fruit that grows in cold, snowy regions known for its tangy, sweet flavor. It doesn't offer any special effects, but it's a popular cooking ingredient.
Item_Fruit_C_Caption: Cacti found in the Gerudo Desert bear this sweet fruit. It's naturally insulated, so when cooked into a dish, it provides resistance against electricity.
Item_Fruit_E_Caption: The plant that bears these seeds grows near deep water. The roots draw nutrients from the water, which boosts your movement speed when the seeds are cooked into a dish.
Item_Fruit_F_Caption: This resilient fruit can flourish even in the heat of the desert. The hydrating liquid inside provides a cooling effect that, when cooked, increases your heat resistance.
Item_Fruit_G_Caption: Fruit from palm trees that grow near the ocean. It doesn't offer any special effects but will increase your heart recovery when used as an ingredient.
Item_Fruit_H_Caption: This fruit grows mainly in tropical forests of the Faron region. When it's used as an ingredient, the resulting dish will temporarily increase your attack power.
Item_Fruit_I_Caption: This pepper is exploding with spice. Cook with it to create dishes that will raise your body temperature and help you withstand the cold.
Item_Fruit_J_Caption: An extremely tough pumpkin raised for food. When cooked, that toughness manifests itself by considerably upping defense.
Item_Fruit_K_Caption: Often found on the ground near trees. Squirrels adore this nut, so you may have competition while foraging. Add one to a meal for a nutty seasoning.
Item_Fruit_L_Caption: Small birds love this nut. You can eat it raw for a minor effect, but it can also be added as a spice to other recipes.
Item_Fruit_M_Caption: A fruit found widely from cold areas to warm climates. Full of nutrition, and kind of trendy lately. Use it in cooking to recover more hearts.
Item_Fruit_N_Caption: A new variety of pumpkin that soaks up the sunshine in Hateno Village. Baked into a dish, it can help heal the effects of exposure to gloom.
Item_Fruit_P_Caption: A rare, very sweet fruit that seems to have an extra sparkle to it. Sometimes found near normal apples.
Item_InsectGet_K_Caption: This crab is well known for its exceptionally sharp pincers. When cooked, the strength compound in its claws will increase your attack power.
Item_InsectGet_O_Caption: This crab's shell is particularly hard. When cooked into a dish, its fat and meat bolster the body to increase your defense.
Item_InsectGet_Z_Caption: This crab appears in large numbers when it rains. One bite of its delectable meat, and you'll forget all your exhaustion. Replenishes your stamina when cooked into a dish.
Item_KingScale_Caption: Zora kings bear this scale on their foreheads. It sparkles in different ways depending on  the angle from which it's viewed. They were once used in ancient Zora ceremonies.
Item_Material_01_Caption: When boiled with other ingredients, the cane breaks down into a sweet juice necessary for making cakes and other sweets. It's commonly found in ingredients stores.
Item_Material_02_Caption: Made from several types of spices, this secret Goron seasoning has been handed down for generations. An initial wave of spiciness paves the way for the sweetness.
Item_Material_03_Caption: This grain is a favorite among residents of Kakariko Village. It's grown in regions with a lot of water and is quite versatile. Used as an ingredient in things like risotto and rice balls.
Item_Material_04_Caption: A fresh bird egg necessary for making dishes such as omelets and crepes. You can snag them from birds' nests if you're sneaky. Nutritious and delicious, perfect for cooking.
Item_Material_05_Caption: This fresh milk comes from Hateno-bred cows and white goats from all across Hyrule. It's delicious on its own, but can be used in soups and stews too.
Item_Material_06_Caption: Butter made from the milk of a domesticated white goat. In addition to being used in dishes like stews and meunière, it's often used when making cakes and other sweets.
Item_Material_07_Caption: This grain is cultivated extensively on the Tabantha Plains. It's ground finely with a millstone to be used in cooking. Use it to make things such as stews and breads.
Item_Material_08_Caption: A result of Kilton's research into monsters, this suspicious spice can be used to punch up dishes while cooking. Apparently it can be used to make a number of monstrous meals.
Item_Material_09_Caption: A mild oil extracted from plant seeds, it's very versatile in cooking and can coax flavors from ingredients used in many dishes. Also good for adding fuel to fire.
Item_Material_10_Caption: A cheese made from Hateno cow's milk. Add it to a warm dish, and enjoy its rich flavor and melty texture.
Item_Material_11_Caption: An unusual substance, it's cold to the touch, and it seems as though it's filled with pitch- black darkness. Use it in cooking to get a gloom-resistant effect.
Item_Meat_01_Caption: Meat obtained from animals in plains and forests. You can eat it raw, but cooking it will make it more delicious and nutritious.
Item_Meat_02_Caption: A fresh, high-quality piece of animal meat. This stuff isn't easy to come by, so savor it. Cook it to recover more hearts.
Item_Meat_06_Caption: This meat is tougher and chewier than a standard steak. Tastes better cooked.
Item_Meat_07_Caption: A high-quality piece of meat that's hard to come by. You can eat it raw, but cooking it first will recover more hearts.
Item_Meat_11_Caption: This prized cut of meat is usually from a large animal. Any connoisseur would rank this tender, juicy cut of meat gourmet. Expect an exquisite meal when cooking with this.
Item_Meat_12_Caption: This prized meat can be obtained from certain birds. It gets full points for flavor, nutrition, and volume. It pairs perfectly with other ingredients or can be enjoyed alone.
Item_Mushroom_A_Caption: A nutritious mushroom chock-full of natural energy. Cook it to release its stamina- restoration properties.
Item_Mushroom_B_Caption: Often found at the base of pine trees in cold climates, these mushrooms are cool to the touch and can be used to cook dishes that allow you to stay cool even in arid regions.
Item_Mushroom_C_Caption: A bright-red mushroom that grows in hot climates. Imbued with the power of heat,  it can be used to cook dishes that will allow you to endure the bitter cold.
Item_Mushroom_E_Caption: A common mushroom found near trees around Hyrule. Eat it to restore half a heart.
Item_Mushroom_F_Caption: This rare mushroom has a rich scent. It'll restore all your hearts and temporarily increase your maximum hearts when used in cooking.
Item_Mushroom_H_Caption: This mushroom grows wild in the Gerudo region. The cap is naturally insulated, so when used in cooking, it will offer protection against electricity.
Item_Mushroom_J_Caption: A strange mushroom that glows softly in the forest at night. Cooking it into a dish unlocks the nutrients in its cap, resulting in a meal that will allow you to move stealthily.
Item_Mushroom_L_Caption: This mushroom is known for the natural slice in its cap. Eating it fosters your competitive spirit. Use it when cooking to prepare a dish that will increase your strength.
Item_Mushroom_M_Caption: The cap of this mushroom is very hard. Use it when cooking to prepare a dish that increases your defense.
Item_Mushroom_N_Caption: Years of going unpicked have allowed this hearty truffle to grow quite large. When cooked into a dish, it'll restore all hearts and temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
Item_Mushroom_O_Caption: A rare yellowish-orange mushroom. Cook it before eating to temporarily increase your stamina limit.
Item_Mushroom_P_Caption: A common mushroom that grows near trees on sky islands. Eat it to restore health.
Item_MushroomGet_D_Caption: A mushroom that can grow almost anywhere but prefers ceilings and sheer cliffs. Cook it before eating to temporarily increase your movement speed.
Item_MushroomGet_K_Caption: A mushroom that grows in caves and contains luminescent enzymes. Cook it into a dish to give a glowing effect to anyone who eats it.
Item_Ore_A_Caption: The most precious ore one can find. Its signature sparkle has charmed Hyruleans for generations. As such, it has sold for a very high price since ancient times.
Item_Ore_B_Caption: A precious red ore mined from large ore deposits. Rubies contain the power of fire and have fetched a high price since ancient times.
Item_Ore_C_Caption: A precious blue ore mined from natural rock formations. Sapphires contain the very essence of ice. They've been known to fetch a high price since ancient times.
Item_Ore_D_Caption: This precious yellow ore contains the power of electricity. It's been known to fetch a high price since ancient times.
Item_Ore_E_Caption: A valuable ore that gives off a mesmerizing iridescence similar to the inside of a seashell. It contains the power of water.
Item_Ore_F_Caption: A fossilized resin with a caramelesque sheen to it. It's been valued as a component in decorations and crafting since ancient times.
Item_Ore_G_Caption: This mysterious mineral gives off a pale blue glow in the dark, which some believe to be souls of the dead. Apparently, this stone can be used as a base to make special clothing.
Item_Ore_H_Caption: Crystallized salt from the ancient sea commonly used to season meals.  Cannot be eaten in this form.
Item_Ore_I_Caption: Strike it with a metallic weapon to generate a spark. This fire starter breaks after one use, but it can create a long-lasting flame if you strike it near firewood.
Item_Ore_J_Caption: A mysterious stone fragment that fell from the sky. Its gem-like quality makes it highly valuable. One theory is that it has the power to light up its environment.
Item_Ore_L_Caption: An unusual mineral that has many purposes. Ancients extracted energy from it and refined it for the crafting of weapons and armor.
Item_Ore_M_Caption: Zonaite of especially high purity. The amount of energy concentrated in it allows for much higher power output than regular zonaite.
Item_PlantGet_A_Caption: This healthy herb has not changed since ancient times. Cook it before eating to increase the number of hearts it restores.
Item_PlantGet_B_Caption: A rare radish that grows best in sunny plains. Cook it before eating to restore all your hearts and temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
Item_PlantGet_C_Caption: This hearty radish is much larger than the average radish. When cooked into a dish, it restores all your hearts and temporarily increases your maximum hearts.
Item_PlantGet_E_Caption: This medicinal plant grows in high elevations, such as mountains in the Hebra or Gerudo regions. When cooked into a dish, it will temporarily increase your heat resistance.
Item_PlantGet_F_Caption: This medicinal plant grows in hot regions, such as the Gerudo Desert. It's warm to the touch and increases your cold resistance when cooked into a dish.
Item_PlantGet_G_Caption: This medicinal plant is known for its sharp thorns and for the fruit it bears. The fruit contains a compound that increases attack power when cooked into a dish.
Item_PlantGet_H_Caption: This tough medicinal plant cannot be broken, but it can be cooked. Its durable yet flexible fibers raise your defense when cooked into a dish.
Item_PlantGet_I_Caption: A plant that grows in quieter areas of Hyrule. At night, it gives off a soft glow. Cook with it to increase your stealth.
Item_PlantGet_J_Caption: This lovely flower was said to have been a favorite of the princess of Hyrule. They were once feared to have gone extinct, but it's not uncommon to spot them growing in the wild.
Item_PlantGet_L_Caption: This medicinal plant grows abundantly in the Gerudo Desert. Its peculiar fibers conduct electricity, which will increase your electricity resistance when cooked into a dish.
Item_PlantGet_M_Caption: This carrot is cultivated extensively in villages. It strengthens the legs and hips when cooked into a dish, which helps increase your movement speed.
Item_PlantGet_O_Caption: This vitality-rich flower blooms mainly on cliffsides. When cooked into a dish, the nourishing compounds increase your movement speed.
Item_PlantGet_Q_Caption: Highly valued as a medicinal plant, this carrot contains large amounts of nourishing energy. When cooked into a dish, it boosts your stamina beyond its maximum limit.
Item_PlantGet_R_Caption: A wild plant that grows in the sun at high altitudes. Soaked in sunlight, its petals can restore health depleted by gloom when used in cooking.
Item_PlantGet_S_Caption: A wild plant with bulging roots often found in cooler climates. It contains nutrients that increase endurance. Cook it to restore stamina.
Item_PlantGet_U_Caption: A mysterious leaf that looks like it might be hiding something behind it. It has some medicinal value. Attach it to a stick and it can be used as a fan.
Item_Roast_01_Caption: Meat cooked over an open flame. Cooking it has increased its flavor and the number of hearts it provides.
Item_Roast_02_Caption: Bird drumstick that's been cooked to a crisp, skin and all. It's devoid of seasoning, but it has a simple, accessible taste. Restores more hearts than the raw variety.
Item_Roast_03_Caption: Direct heat has softened and sweetened this apple. Eat it to restore three-quarters of a heart.
Item_Roast_04_Caption: This toasted stamella shroom doesn't grant any special effects, but it will restore a bit of health.
Item_Roast_05_Caption: A hearty truffle toasted until its outside is crispy. It tastes great, but hearty truffles are far more effective when cooked in a recipe.
Item_Roast_06_Caption: A Hylian shroom toasted to perfection. The taste and fragrance are amplified, restoring more health to its consumer.
Item_Roast_07_Caption: This wildberry was prepared over an open flame to alter its sweet taste. It recovers more health than if eaten raw.
Item_Roast_08_Caption: This voltfruit from the Gerudo Desert has been charred to really bring out its sweet and sour flavors.
Item_Roast_10_Caption: This palm fruit was broiled with direct heat, resulting in steamed flesh inside the rind. Best served at the moment the juices emerge while roasting.
Item_Roast_11_Caption: These mighty bananas have been roasted whole. Cooking them through has turned the fruit inside into a sticky, rich, aromatic syrup.
Item_Roast_12_Caption: This hydromelon was roasted whole for a very soft and flaky inner flesh with a rather intriguing flavor. Now this is your money melon!
Item_Roast_13_Caption: A pepper that's been gently caressed by an open flame. It's much less spicy now.
Item_Roast_15_Caption: This fortified pumpkin has been roasted whole. The hard rind serves as a container for the steamed pumpkin flesh inside.
Item_Roast_16_Caption: Flame-roasted fleet-lotus seeds. Peel the skin back to get to the soft and flaky center.
Item_Roast_18_Caption: A roasted hearty radish. Fragrant and warm, it has no special effect but will restore hearts.
Item_Roast_19_Caption: A roasted big hearty radish. To take such a precious vegetable and put it to the fire is decadent in a way.
Item_Roast_24_Caption: A fragrant swift carrot that's been lightly roasted. It doesn't have any special effects, but it will restore some health.
Item_Roast_27_Caption: Lightly toasted mighty thistle. It has no special effects, but now that it's been grilled, the pointy ends go down smooth.
Item_Roast_28_Caption: Simple, roasted armoranth. The heat has frayed the hard, chewy fiber just enough to make it easy to eat.
Item_Roast_31_Caption: A fully roasted chillshroom. It's evenly toasted and tastes a lot better than when eaten raw. Eating it will restore a bit of health.
Item_Roast_32_Caption: It's always a good idea to keep a fully roasted sunshroom or two on hand just in case. Eat it to recover a bit of health.
Item_Roast_33_Caption: It's not very shocking that this fully roasted zapshroom is delicious. Eat it to recover a bit of health.
Item_Roast_36_Caption: A rushroom that's been put to the torch. It may have lost its speedy properties, but at least it tastes good now.
Item_Roast_37_Caption: A razorshroom that's been exposed to direct heat. Its sharp exterior has softened considerably. Restores a bit of health.
Item_Roast_38_Caption: An ironshroom exposed to an open flame. Its once-tough exterior is now crunchy and tasty. Restores a bit of health.
Item_Roast_39_Caption: A whole, toasted silent shroom. High heat may have destroyed its soft glow, but it's now fragrant and tasty.
Item_Roast_40_Caption: Prime meat cooked over an open flame. The outside is perfectly browned, while the inside is mouthwateringly juicy.
Item_Roast_41_Caption: Prime meat that's been flame-seared to perfection. The outside is crispy, but the inside is juicy. Eat it to recover hearts.
Item_Roast_45_Caption: The highest quality gourmet meat, just kissed by an open flame. No additional seasonings have been added, which lets the natural flavor of the meat really shine.
Item_Roast_46_Caption: This whole bird has been tickled by an open flame to bring out its flavor. Less is more, as the lack of additional seasoning allows its natural taste to shine.
Item_Roast_48_Caption: An acorn cooked with direct heat. Its nutty aroma has been amplified.
Item_Roast_49_Caption: This big hearty truffle has been roasted whole. It gets full points for aroma and nutrition. Eat it to recover a lot of hearts.
Item_Roast_50_Caption: This flame-kissed endura carrot makes for a truly extravagant single-item dish. The fire really brought out its sweetness.
Item_Roast_51_Caption: Roasting a bird egg whole in its shell like this helps retain water, making the egg a bit chewier than usual.
Item_Roast_52_Caption: A tree seed roasted to amplify its fragrance. Gives more hearts than the raw variety.
Item_Roast_53_Caption: A toasted endura shroom. It doesn't grant any special effects, but boy is it tasty!
Item_Roast_54_Caption: A Hylian tomato toasted whole. It's juicy inside and will restore more health when consumed.
Item_Roast_55_Caption: A large, whole, roasted sun pumpkin. It lost its original effect in the baking process, but it's soft and tasty.
Item_Roast_56_Caption: A simply grilled skyshroom. The heat brings out its flavor and increases the amount of health it can restore.
Item_Roast_58_Caption: A whole, roasted brightcap. Sure, it loses its bioluminescent enzymes, but it's softer and easier to chew.
Item_Roast_59_Caption: A luxurious snack of golden apple roasted directly over a fire. The impeccable balance between acidity and sweetness gives it an otherworldly, delicious flavor.
Item_RoastFish_01_Caption: A bass that's been cooked whole over an open flame. It's flaky and savory smelling. Offers more hearts than the raw version.
Item_RoastFish_02_Caption: An open flame has crisped the skin of this hearty bass to perfection. It's a sizable portion and contains just the right amount of fat to create an exceptionally tasty dish.
Item_RoastFish_03_Caption: This trout can be found all over Hyrule. Served river-to-table, it's simply cooked for a soft and flaky flesh with a mild flavor.
Item_RoastFish_04_Caption: A fresh hearty salmon roasted simply over an open flame without any additional flavoring. Not only is the skin edible but it gives off a rather nice aroma as well.
Item_RoastFish_07_Caption: Roasting this freshwater carp helped to suppress some of its stench, making it easier to stomach. You can really sink your teeth into the thick, meaty flesh.
Item_RoastFish_09_Caption: The soft and fluffy texture of this seafaring fish has been enhanced by roasting it over an open fire. The crisp, aromatic skin is particularly delicious.
Item_RoastFish_13_Caption: Sneaky river snail roasted whole in its shell. The meat is soft and a little chewy. Pulling all the meat from the shell in one go fills you with a sense of accomplishment.
Item_RoastFish_15_Caption: A whole crab slow-roasted in its shell. The soft, flaky flesh pairs nicely with the scent of the charred shell for a meal that assaults all five of your senses in all the best ways.
Item_RoastFish_16_Caption: A whole, grilled ancient arowana. The meat is cooked through and has reached a perfect tenderness.
Item_RoastFish_18_Caption: A dish of grilled glowing cave fish. The fish's loose meat is nicely cooked to give it both excellent flavor and texture.
Item_StableHostelAccommodationCoupon_A_C: A lodging voucher for a regular stable bed. A reward for collecting Pony Points. Spend it at a stable to get some rest and recover from the fatigue of travel.
Item_Weapon_01_Caption: An ancient dagger-like blade. It's too small to wield as a weapon, but it can be used as an arrowhead.
KeySmall_Caption: A key to a door inside a Shrine of Light.
LightBall_Large_Caption: A seed that's found underground. When struck, it will take root and bloom, radiating a large amount of light from a big flower.
LightBall_Small_Caption: A seed that's often found in caves or wells. When struck, it will take root and bloom, giving off faint light from a small flower.
LightFruit_Caption: A fruit charged with powerful light. Break it to unleash dazzling sparkles that blind any monsters nearby.
MinusRupee_00_Caption: A glowing spirit orb found all over the Depths. Offer these to a Bargainer Statue for a variety of rewards.
MinusRupee_01_Caption: A glowing spirit orb found all over the Depths. Offer these to a Bargainer Statue for rewards. They seem to possess great power.
MinusRupee_02_Caption: A glowing spirit orb found all over the Depths. Offer these to a Bargainer Statue for rewards. They seem to possess vast power.
NormalArrow_Caption: A common arrow. Its shaft was carved from the wood of a sturdy tree.
Obj_ArrowBundle_A_01_Caption: A bundle of five common arrows. The shafts of these arrows were carved from the wood of a sturdy tree.
Obj_ArrowBundle_A_02_Caption: A bundle of 10 common arrows. The shafts of these arrows were carved from the wood of a sturdy tree.
Obj_AutoBuilder_Caption: Instantly re-create your Ultrahand projects, using nearby items and zonaite. Autobuild records your previous creations.
Obj_AutoBuilderDraft_00_Caption: A stone etched with what looks like a design schematic. It could be useful...
Obj_AutoBuilderDraft_00_Caption_HasAutoB: These stone slabs depict schematics of things such as Zonai vehicles. Autobuild saves the schematic and builds it on command.
Obj_AutoBuilderDraftAssassin_00_Caption: A schematic for a strange invention made of Zonai devices and building materials. Looks like it could be useful...
Obj_AutoBuilderDraftAssassin_00_Caption_: A scrawled schematic for a contraption made of Zonai devices and building materials. Looks like you can use Autobuild to store schematics and then build from them.
Obj_Battery_Get_Caption: A gift from a Zonai construct. Designed to be worn on a belt, it can power Zonai devices.
Obj_Battery_Get_Caption_Unlock: A portable power source charged with the energy needed to use some Zonai devices. It recharges over time automatically.
Obj_Camera_Caption: Capture images using the Purah Pad. You can then save them to the album.
Obj_CaveWellHonor_00_Caption: To thank you for finding the locations of all the wells in Hyrule, Fera awarded you this beautiful model of a well encased in a glass sphere.
Obj_CheckPointHonor_00_Caption: An award for one who has conquered the darkness by lighting up every lightroot. This special item commemorates blessings received.
Obj_DefeatHonor_00_Caption: An award presented by the monster-control crew in appreciation for defeating every Stone Talus in Hyrule. It's very fancy and is shaped like the monster it represents.
Obj_DefeatHonor_01_Caption: An award presented by the monster-control crew in appreciation for defeating every Hinox in Hyrule. It's very fancy and is shaped like the monster it represents.
Obj_DefeatHonor_02_Caption: An award presented by the monster-control crew in appreciation for defeating every Molduga in Hyrule. It's very fancy and is shaped like the monster it represents.
Obj_DefeatHonor_03_Caption: An award presented by the monster-control crew in appreciation for defeating every Frox in Hyrule. It's very fancy and is shaped like the monster it represents.
Obj_DefeatHonor_04_Caption: An award presented by the monster-control crew in appreciation for defeating every Flux Construct in Hyrule. It's very fancy and is shaped like the monster it represents.
Obj_DefeatHonor_05_Caption: An award presented by the monster-control crew in appreciation for defeating every Gleeok in Hyrule. It's very fancy and is shaped like the monster it represents.
Obj_DRStone_Get_Caption: Princess Zelda's prized device. It has a variety of features that are essential for adventure.
Obj_DungeonClearSeal_Caption: A crystal that glows with a light that purges ancient evil and purifies with its radiance.
Obj_EnergyUtuwa_A_01_Caption: A small part made from crystallized charges. It increases the maximum energy that can be stored in your Energy Cell.
Obj_FireWoodBundle_Caption: A portable bundle of wood. You can use this to make a campfire if you have something to light it.
Obj_HeartUtuwa_A_01_Caption: A rare item that restores some of the life force you lost to the gloom, increasing your maximum number of hearts by one.
Obj_HiddenScroll_00_Caption: An esoteric manual that reveals the secret of the Earthwake technique known only to Yiga blademasters. It's a move that involves executing a charge attack with no weapons.
Obj_KorokNuts_Caption: This small seed was given to you by a Korok. It has a distinct smell. If you gather a bunch of them, you never know what may happen...
Obj_Mineral_A_01_Caption: This deposit contains a good deal of ore. Breaking the rock will yield rock salt, flint, and other ore and minerals of varying value.
Obj_Mineral_B_01_Caption: This deposit contains a good deal of precious ore and the occasional rare mineral, like ruby and sapphire. Break it open to see what it has to offer!
Obj_Mineral_C_01_Caption: This deposit contains quite a bit of luminous stone. Crack it open to get at the easily processed rocks within.
Obj_Mineral_D_01_Caption: This deposit glows with mysterious energy and is very common in the Depths. If you crack it open, you can claim the zonaite within.
Obj_OneTouchBond_Caption: Attach something to an equipped weapon or shield to enhance it. You can undo the fusion, but that will destroy whatever has been attached.
Obj_Photo_Animal_Caption: A picture of an animal, bird, fish, or insect.
Obj_Photo_BossEnemy_Caption: A picture of a powerful monster that at one time stood in your way.
Obj_Photo_Enemy_Caption: A picture of one of the various monsters that can be found throughout Hyrule.
Obj_Photo_Material_Caption: A picture of a cooking ingredient, such as an apple or a mushroom.
Obj_Photo_Other_Caption: A picture of an exciting subject, such as a  treasure chest or ore.
Obj_Photo_Weapon_Caption: A picture of a battle-tested weapon, such as a sword, spear, or bow.
Obj_ProofKorok_Caption: A gift of friendship given to you by Hestu. It smells pretty bad.
Obj_ReverseRecorder_Caption: Reverse an object's movement until it goes back to where it was. You can stop the reverse movement at any time.
Obj_SageSoul_Gerudo_Caption: Proof of the vow of Riju, Sage of Lightning. Use it to summon or dismiss the avatar of Riju.
Obj_SageSoul_Gerudo_Name: Vow of Riju, Sage of Lightning
Obj_SageSoul_Goron_Caption: Proof of the vow of Yunobo, Sage of Fire. Use it to summon or dismiss the avatar of Yunobo.
Obj_SageSoul_Goron_Name: Vow of Yunobo, Sage of Fire
Obj_SageSoul_Rito_Caption: Proof of the vow of Tulin, Sage of Wind. Use it to summon or dismiss the avatar of Tulin.
Obj_SageSoul_Rito_Name: Vow of Tulin, Sage of Wind
Obj_SageSoul_Zonau_Caption: Proof of the vow of Mineru, Sage of Spirit. Use it to summon or dismiss the construct containing Mineru's spirit.
Obj_SageSoul_Zonau_Name: Vow of Mineru, Sage of Spirit
Obj_SageSoul_Zora_Caption: Proof of the vow of Sidon, Sage of Water. Use it to summon or dismiss the avatar of Sidon.
Obj_SageSoul_Zora_Name: Vow of Sidon, Sage of Water
Obj_SageSoulPlus_Gerudo_Caption: The strengthened vow of Riju, Sage of Lightning. Your reinforced bond with Riju has increased her avatar's attack power.
Obj_SageSoulPlus_Gerudo_Name: Solemn Vow of Riju, Sage of Lightning
Obj_SageSoulPlus_Goron_Caption: The strengthened vow of Yunobo, Sage of Fire. Your reinforced bond with Yunobo has increased his avatar's attack power.
Obj_SageSoulPlus_Goron_Name: Solemn Vow of Yunobo, Sage of Fire
Obj_SageSoulPlus_Rito_Caption: The strengthened vow of Tulin, Sage of Wind. Your reinforced bond with Tulin has increased his avatar's attack power.
Obj_SageSoulPlus_Rito_Name: Solemn Vow of Tulin, Sage of Wind
Obj_SageSoulPlus_Zonau_Caption: The strengthened vow of Mineru, Sage of Spirit. Your reinforced bond with Mineru has increased her construct's attack power.
Obj_SageSoulPlus_Zonau_Name: Solemn Vow of Mineru, Sage of Spirit
Obj_SageSoulPlus_Zora_Caption: The strengthened vow of Sidon, Sage of Water. Your reinforced bond with Sidon has increased his avatar's attack power.
Obj_SageSoulPlus_Zora_Name: Solemn Vow of Sidon, Sage of Water
Obj_SageWill_Caption: A small stone believed to have belonged to a sage. Holding it in your hand, you can feel the remnants of a strong bond.
Obj_SageWill_Caption_HasSageSoul: The remnants of a former Sage's resolve. If you gather four of them and offer them to a Goddess Statue, you can deepen your connection with the Sages.
Obj_StableHostlePointCard_Caption: Using a stable earns points. Collecting points  grants rewards. Points needed for the next reward:
Obj_StableHostlePointCard_Caption_Receiv: Using a stable earns points. Collecting points grants rewards. You are eligible for a reward.
Obj_StaminaUtuwa_A_01_Caption: An important item that restores some of the stamina you lost to the gloom, increasing the size of your Stamina Wheel.
Obj_SubstituteCloth_00_Caption: Tough fabric bearing a Goron design. It looks like it could be used to make a paraglider.
Obj_SubstituteCloth_01_Caption: Tough fabric bearing a Zora design. It looks like it could be used to make a paraglider.
Obj_SubstituteCloth_02_Caption: Tough fabric bearing a Gerudo design. It looks like it could be used to make a paraglider.
