Obj_SubstituteCloth_53_Caption: Tough fabric bearing a Gerudo-king design. It looks like it could be used to make a paraglider.
Obj_SubstituteCloth_55_Caption: Tough fabric bearing a nostalgic design. It looks like it could be used to make a paraglider.
Obj_SubstituteCloth_56_Caption: Tough fabric bearing an image of Hudson, hand-drawn by Addison. It looks like it could be used to make a paraglider.
Obj_Tooreroof_Caption: Move upward through solid material and emerge on top of it.
Obj_TreasureMap_00_Caption: A very old map that shows a marked spot. What could be there?
Obj_UltraHand_Caption: Grab and move objects, rotate them, and stick them to other objects.
Obj_WarpDLC_Caption: This mysterious tool was built by Robbie. Place it by opening your inventory and registering your current location as a travel gate.
Obj_WarpDLC_Prototype_Caption: Robbie reverse-engineered a travel medallion to make this prototypical version, but it's unusable in its current state because it's missing some important data.
Parasail_Caption: This item, given to you by Purah, lets you ride the wind and glide through the sky. Press R in midair to activate it.
PutRupee_Blue_Caption: Five rupees. Its shiny blue facets make you weak in the knees.
PutRupee_Caption: A single rupee. Its soft green glow puts a smile on your face.
PutRupee_Gold_Caption: 300 rupees! Its radiant golden shine illuminates your soul.
PutRupee_Purple_Caption: 50 rupees. Its violet glow fills your heart with generosity.
PutRupee_Red_Caption: 20 rupees. Its red luster tickles your heartstrings.
PutRupee_Silver_Caption: 100 rupees. Its dazzling silver light reflects your beaming smile.
SmokeFruit_Caption: A mushroom that spreads a cloud of fine spores when a stimulus is applied. The bitter powder makes them inedible.
SpObj_BalloonEnvelope_Capsule_A_01_Capti: A Zonai device that rises when filled with hot air. The hotter the air, the quicker it rises.
SpObj_Beamos_Capsule_A_01_Caption: A Zonai device that shoots a light beam from its horn, inflicting damage at great range.
SpObj_Cannon_Capsule_A_01_Caption: A Zonai device that fires shots in intervals. The shot explodes when hitting the target. It's a powerful device, but it can be tricky to get the firing angle just right.
SpObj_Cart_Capsule_A_01_Caption: A Zonai device built to move efficiently over flat surfaces. Apply force to get it moving, so long as it has a power source.
SpObj_Chaser_Capsule_A_01_Caption: A Zonai device that automatically heads for monsters. It's believed to have been used by the Zonai as a security measure.
SpObj_ControlStick_Capsule_A_01_Caption: A Zonai device that can control direction when attached to a conveyance. It'll activate all connected Zonai devices at once.
SpObj_CookSet_Capsule_A_01_Caption: A Zonai device for cooking food almost anytime, anywhere. It lasts for cooking one recipe only. The device is easier to use on flat surfaces.
SpObj_ElectricBoxGenerator_Capsule_A_01_: A Zonai device that shoots a shocking bolt from its horn when struck. Oddly, only the horn conducts the bolt. The rest of the head is safe to hold.
SpObj_EnergyBank_Capsule_A_01_Caption: A Zonai device that holds concentrated Zonai-charge energy. Use it to provide temporary power for other Zonai devices.
SpObj_EnergyBank_Capsule_A_02_Caption: A battery with an improved compression rate. Though disposable, it holds multiple times as much energy as a normal battery.
SpObj_FastWheel_Capsule_A_01_Caption: A powered Zonai device that spins quickly and is best suited for flat surfaces. It doesn't handle hills, or even bumps, very well.
SpObj_FastWheel_Capsule_B_01_Caption: A powered Zonai device that wants to move! It's a big, mean wheel that excels at tearing through environments that might challenge smaller wheels. It can handle shallow water.
SpObj_FlameThrower_Capsule_A_01_Caption: A Zonai device that shoots fire. It's thought to have been originally used as protection from monsters.
SpObj_FlashLight_Capsule_A_01_Caption: A Zonai device that can bring some light to dark places. It shines in one direction, and its light doesn't reach too far, but it can come in handy on dark roads or in caves.
SpObj_FloatingStone_Capsule_A_01_Caption: A Zonai device that can defy gravity and hang in place. Ages ago, the Zonai may have used this technology to create islands that float in the sky.
SpObj_GolemHead_Capsule_A_01_Caption: A Zonai device that always faces whatever it deems an enemy. Attach a combat Zonai device to the head for homing attacks.
SpObj_LiftableWaterPump_Capsule_A_01_Cap: A Zonai device that gushes water when struck. According to legend, sky islands saw water shortages long ago but became lush and fertile thanks to this technology.
SpObj_LiftGeneratorWing_Capsule_A_01_Cap: A Zonai device that can harness lift to ride the wind. To fly farther, try balancing in the center of the wing.
SpObj_LightMirror_Capsule_A_01_Caption: A Zonai device that focuses and reflects light. It can provide powerful, long-distance illumination that can ward off some monsters.
SpObj_Pile_Capsule_A_01_Caption: A Zonai device that can be fixed in place in the ground or on a wall. They've been used as footholds and building foundations because of their immovability when planted.
SpObj_Rocket_Capsule_A_01_Caption: A Zonai device that produces powerful thrust. It packs a punch but burns out quickly.
SpObj_SlipBoard_Capsule_A_01_Caption: A Zonai device with a slick underside that minimizes friction. Probably used to convey things over grass and sand in ancient times.
SpObj_SnowMachine_Capsule_A_01_Caption: A Zonai device that blasts out freezing air, handy for slowing and defeating some monsters. Also, some materials change their properties when exposed to very cold air.
SpObj_SpringPiston_Capsule_A_01_Caption: A Zonai device that contracts and then expands with enough power to bounce objects away from it.
SpObj_TiltingDoll_Capsule_A_01_Caption: A perfectly balanced Zonai device that stands upright when activated. It was used to secure footholds in unstable places, such as sky islands.
SpObj_TimerBomb_Capsule_A_01_Caption: A Zonai device for a timed explosion. Its blast can activate other Zonai devices.
SpObj_WindGenerator_Capsule_A_01_Caption: A Zonai device that produces wind with its internal propeller. It's likely that the Zonai made smart use of this wind power to transport objects and generate thrust.
TBox_Field_Iron_Caption: Fortunes untold (potentially) await the lucky adventurer who finds one of these. Chests can often be found within shrines or at enemy camps, but there may be some crafty folks who think they're safer underground.
WaterFruit_Caption: A fruit that contains pressurized water. Cooking it brings out its ability to enhance swim speed when ingested.
Weapon_Bow_001_Caption: A small bow used by travelers for protection. It doesn't do a lot of damage, but it can be used to attack foes from a distance.
Weapon_Bow_002_Caption: A bow designed for armed conflict. Inflicts more damage than a civilian bow, but it will still burn if it touches fire.
Weapon_Bow_003_Caption: An upgraded Boko bow bound with animal bone to boost its durability and firepower. Its craftsmanship is sloppy, but it's light and easy to use.
Weapon_Bow_004_Caption: A basic Bokoblin bow made of wood. It's made by taking any tree branch and just tying a string to either end, so don't expect much in the way of combat effectiveness.
Weapon_Bow_006_Caption: A wooden bow created by Lizalfos. It's reinforced by the bones of a large fish— a marked improvement over any standard wooden bow.
Weapon_Bow_009_Caption: A Lynel-made bow crafted from rough metal. True to the vicious nature of Lynel weaponry, it fires a spread of multiple arrows at once. Ideal for taking down quick-moving targets.
Weapon_Bow_011_Caption: A Lizal bow with a grip reinforced by metal. The body is made from the branches of a flexible tree that grows near water, which offers some serious destructive power.
Weapon_Bow_013_Caption: The Koroks made this bow for Hylians. It's crafted from flexible wood and uses sturdy vines for the bowstring. Its construction may be simple, but it fires multiple arrows at once.
Weapon_Bow_014_Caption: A bow favored by the Zora for fishing. It doesn't boast the highest firepower, but the special metal it's crafted from prioritizes durability.
Weapon_Bow_015_Caption: This Gerudo-made bow is popular for the fine ornamentations along its limbs. Designed for hunting and warfare alike, this bow was engineered to strike distant targets.
Weapon_Bow_016_Caption: This bow is a favorite among Rito warriors. The bowstring has been specially engineered for aerial combat, which allows it to be drawn faster than a normal bow.
Weapon_Bow_017_Caption: A highly refined Rito-made bow created by a master Rito craftsman. Rito warriors favor it for its superior rate of fire, which helps them excel even further at aerial combat.
Weapon_Bow_026_Caption: This massive Lynel bow sports a bowstring made from a metal so tough, mere Hylians have trouble drawing it back.
Weapon_Bow_027_Caption: A Boko bow reinforced by fossils. Bokoblins handpicked the materials it's made from, so it boasts a respectable firepower.
Weapon_Bow_028_Caption: A bow without equal wielded by the Rito Champion, Revali. It's said Revali could loose arrows with the speed of a gale, making him supreme in aerial combat.
Weapon_Bow_029_Caption: A bow passed down through the Sheikah tribe. Concentrating before drawing the string will allow you to target distant enemies as easily as those nearby.
Weapon_Bow_030_Caption: This bow is wielded by Lizalfos who are expert marksmen. The metal that reinforces much of the weapon adds some additional weight but offers heightened durability.
Weapon_Bow_032_Caption: This Lynel bow is made from a special steel found at the peak of Death Mountain. It has tremendous stopping power and can pierce thick armor as easily as thin paper.
Weapon_Bow_033_Caption: This prototype Sheikah-made bow was designed to fight the Great Calamity. Made with ancient technology, it boasts a high rate of fire and firepower but has low durability.
Weapon_Bow_035_Caption: The sturdy metal construction of this bow offers superior durability, while its lack of firing quirks makes it quite reliable. Once favored by the knights at Hyrule Castle.
Weapon_Bow_036_Caption: In the past, the king of Hyrule presented this bow to only the most talented archers in the land. Its combat capabilities are as impressive as its extravagant design.
Weapon_Bow_038_Caption: This wooden bow may not be the most reliable for battling monsters, but it is excellent for hunting small animals.
Weapon_Bow_040_Caption: A bow favored by the skilled archers of the Yiga Clan. It's been engineered to fire two arrows at once to ensure your target comes to a swift and none-too-pleasant halt.
Weapon_Bow_072_Caption: A bow that's been in the royal family for ages. Said to have been used by a princess who fought beasts of twilight. It forcefully fires long-range arrows.
Weapon_Bow_101_Caption: A Zonai bow that draws power from your Energy Cell. Power drains, and arrows can fly much farther according to how long a shot is charged.
Weapon_Bow_104_Caption: A bow used by a Captain Construct. Though simply built, it is made of fireproof materials and won't catch fire as wooden bows do.
Weapon_Bow_105_Caption: A sturdy bow for a Captain Construct. Besides being fireproof, it's been strengthened to allow for more powerful shots.
Weapon_Bow_106_Caption: A powerful bow for a Captain Construct. Though still fireproof, it's more complex than earlier models. The bowstring is extremely tense and requires great strength to draw.
Weapon_Bow_107_Caption: A wooden bow from the olden days. It's built for hunting, but it's not very powerful.
Weapon_Bow_166_Caption: A magical bow prized by the Demon King. Its performance reflects the power of its wielder. The higher your maximum number of hearts, the more its attack power increases.
Weapon_Lsword_001_Caption: A basic two-handed sword once wielded by aspiring adventurers. Its immense weight can knock enemies' shields right out of their hands.
Weapon_Lsword_002_Caption: An improved claymore, made lightweight for easier handling. It consumes less stamina for charged attacks.
Weapon_Lsword_003_Caption: Only the strongest of Hyrule Castle's knights carried this two-handed sword. It can yield powerful attacks when you're down to your last heart.
Weapon_Lsword_019_Caption: A Moblin bone that continues to move even after being detached from its body. The bone is thick enough to be used as a weapon but is extremely brittle and easily broken.
Weapon_Lsword_020_Caption: A two-handed sword not properly cared for. Although it can be used as a weapon, its durability is very low. Don't expect it to last for more than a few strikes.
Weapon_Lsword_024_Caption: A two-handed sword issued to the Hyrulean royal family's immediate guard detail. Yields a powerful strike and increases the power of flurry rush during perfect dodge.
Weapon_Lsword_027_Caption: A longsword made by the Zora using a special metal. It's rarely used because the Zora prefer to use spears. It yields high attack power when it gets wet.
Weapon_Lsword_029_Caption: Only the most talented Gerudo sword fighters carry this two-handed sword. Attaching a material greatly enhances the material's power but doesn't add as much durability.
Weapon_Lsword_036_Caption: A Goron-made two-handed weapon. It's made from thick, hard metal and has no cutting edge, but its weight and hard surface make it a great tool for breaking rocks.
Weapon_Lsword_038_Caption: Made for paddling boats, but it was made sturdy enough to fight strong currents. Maybe it's useful for self-defense in a pinch.
Weapon_Lsword_041_Caption: A single-edged sword seldom seen in Hyrule. This weapon is passed down through the Sheikah tribe. When wielded by a proficient fighter, it cleaves wind and creates vacuum.
Weapon_Lsword_045_Caption: A farming tool primarily used for tilling fields. Its fine craftsmanship is sturdy enough to withstand backbreaking fieldwork, but its battle applications are untested.
Weapon_Lsword_047_Caption: The Sheikah used the very essence of ancient technology to forge this greatsword. It's low in durability, but its magic yields massive destructive power just before it breaks.
Weapon_Lsword_051_Caption: This massive boomerang requires two hands. Originally used for hunting, it was modified for use as a weapon. The blades on the inner curves make it a bit tricky to wield.
Weapon_Lsword_054_Caption: This two-handed weapon was once wielded by the Goron Champion Daruk. Daruk made swinging it around look easy, but a Hylian would need an immense amount of strength.
Weapon_Lsword_057_Caption: A slender claymore thought to have been handed down to the kingdom of Hyrule ages ago. The blade shines with a holy luster.
Weapon_Lsword_059_Caption: A legendary greatsword forged by a Goron craftsman for a hero who traveled through time. The exceptionally sharp cutting edge is a testament to the craftsman's mastery.
Weapon_Lsword_060_Caption: A peculiar greatsword allegedly used by a hero from a world in which the moon threatened to fall. It slashes wildly in battle as if possessed by a Fierce Deity.
Weapon_Lsword_101_Caption: A large sword used by the Zonai and made of zonaite. It resonates with attached Zonai devices to slightly increase its attack power.
Weapon_Lsword_103_Caption: A stick cut off from a large tree. It isn't very sturdy, but its heavier end can swat a shield away.
Weapon_Lsword_106_Caption: A basic two-handed sword once wielded by aspiring adventurers. It's decayed and no longer cuts well, but it can still knock a shield right out of enemies' hands.
Weapon_Lsword_108_Caption: A solid stick cut from the crooked branch of a tough tree. It has high durability, despite the way it looks.
Weapon_Lsword_109_Caption: A stick cut from a tree trunk. It's been dried to increase its hardness. It has high attack power for something made of wood.
Weapon_Lsword_112_Caption: A lightweight metal weapon forged for royal soldiers. It's decayed now, but still easy to wield, so it consumes less stamina during charge attacks.
Weapon_Lsword_113_Caption: A claymore, now decayed, once carried by knights of Hyrule. It resonates with the desire to protect at all costs and can yield powerful attacks when you're down to your last heart.
Weapon_Lsword_114_Caption: A longblade that no longer cuts as well as it once did, due to its decayed edge. However, when wielded by a proficient fighter, it cleaves the wind and creates a vacuum.
Weapon_Lsword_124_Caption: A large sword, now decayed, issued to the royal family's guard. It's tuned for skilled users and yields a powerful flurry rush during a perfect dodge.
Weapon_Lsword_127_Caption: A decayed Zora longsword, it's suited for battles near water because it's made of an unusual metal that increases attack power when it's wet.
Weapon_Lsword_129_Caption: A two-handed Gerudo sword with a decayed blade. Attaching a material greatly enhances the material's power but doesn't add as much durability.
Weapon_Lsword_136_Caption: In its former state, this hefty weapon knocked out many a foe. Decayed, it still packs a punch and is great for breaking rocks.
Weapon_Lsword_147_Caption: A decayed claymore prototype for the royal guard. It's made of a metal refined using an unusual method, and it holds massive destructive power just before it breaks.
Weapon_Lsword_161_Caption: A long and mysterious magical rod, it's said to have been wielded by an ancient magician who awoke the latent power of gems.
Weapon_Lsword_163_Caption: A strong, large sword used by the Zonai and made of zonaite. It resonates with attached Zonai devices to increase some of its attack power.
Weapon_Lsword_164_Caption: A powerful, large sword used by Zonai and made of zonaite. It resonates with attached Zonai devices to greatly increase its attack power.
Weapon_Lsword_166_Caption: A metal stick filled with madness and symbolic of doom. Its forceful strike can smash an object to pieces. Its gloom will gradually wear down the body of its wielder.
Weapon_Lsword_168_Caption: A thick bat cut from a large tree. It's not the sturdiest weapon, but its heavy end does have a bit of power behind it.
Weapon_Lsword_174_Caption: A massive boomerang that is weathered and decayed. It was originally used for hunting, but it can be a challenge to wield. Thrown well, it will come back to the thrower.
Weapon_Shield_001_Caption: This lightweight, simple shield is ideal for less experienced fighters. It can withstand light attacks, but blocking stronger blows is not recommended.
Weapon_Shield_002_Caption: A shield once used by the guards of Hyrule Castle. It's easy to handle, but its core is  made of wood, so it can catch fire.
Weapon_Shield_003_Caption: A shield favored by the knights who served the Hyrulean royal family. Its sturdy metal construction makes it quite durable, but its weight requires decent skill to wield.
Weapon_Shield_004_Caption: A Bokoblin-made shield created by attaching a handhold to any flat tree bark picked up off the ground. It's pretty shoddy, so don't expect it to last very long.
Weapon_Shield_005_Caption: A Boko shield made of slightly stronger wood and reinforced with animal bones.
Weapon_Shield_006_Caption: This Boko shield is reinforced with fossilized bone. Its defensive capabilities are respectable, but its predictably slipshod craftsmanship spells low durability.
Weapon_Shield_007_Caption: A common shield found among the Lizalfos. It's made of metal, but its sloppy craftsmanship offers poor durability.
Weapon_Shield_008_Caption: This Lizal shield has been strengthened by adding a different type of metal to the mix. The edge is lined with spikes, so handle with care.
Weapon_Shield_009_Caption: This Lizal shield is adorned with several metal shells as a means of reinforcement. Its defensive capabilities are high, but its weight requires a skilled soldier to bear.
Weapon_Shield_016_Caption: A sturdy shield favored by Lynels for its defensive and offensive capabilities. First and foremost a shield, but the bladed edges can deal slashing attacks when deflecting.
Weapon_Shield_017_Caption: This Lynel-made shield has been reinforced with armor and even more blades. Stronger in both defense and offense, it can tear through basic armor when deflecting.
Weapon_Shield_018_Caption: This ultimate Lynel shield is favored by the White-Maned Lynels. It excels at defending against even the most brutal of attacks and cutting down powerful foes when deflecting.
Weapon_Shield_021_Caption: It's likely this rusty old shield once belonged to a knight. It still has some defensive capabilities, but its usefulness has been worn down by time.
Weapon_Shield_022_Caption: A shield issued to the Hyrulean royal family's immediate guard detail. It boasts a high defense, but these days it's more a collector's item due to its ornamentation.
Weapon_Shield_023_Caption: The Koroks made this shield specifically for Hylians. It's made from the finest hard wood of trees that grow only in Korok Forest, so it's sturdier than it looks.
Weapon_Shield_025_Caption: A Zora-made shield adorned with intricate ornamentation. It's said that true masters of this shield can redirect attacks as a rock redirects rushing water.
Weapon_Shield_026_Caption: The design of this metal shield has changed over time to match the Gerudo's sword-and- shield fighting style. It's favored by soldiers and travelers alike.
Weapon_Shield_030_Caption: A shield passed down through the Hyrulean royal family, along with the legend of the hero who wielded it. Its defensive capabilities and durability outshine all other shields.
Weapon_Shield_031_Caption: Favored by hunters for its rabbit design, which is said to bring luck on hunts. It's easy to use, but its durability leaves something to be desired.
Weapon_Shield_032_Caption: Often carried by fishermen for its fish design, which represents hope for a great catch. Its light wooden construction makes it convenient to take onto a boat.
Weapon_Shield_033_Caption: This shield was forged using ancient Sheikah technology. It boasts extremely high stopping power, but its structural weakness made its low durability impractical for combat.
Weapon_Shield_034_Caption: This shield features a traditional design from Necluda. Its combat capabilities aren't much better than the standard wooden shield, but it found popularity for its design.
Weapon_Shield_035_Caption: A sturdy shield loved by many an adventurer. It is made of animal hide and sturdy wood and is best suited to defending against weak monsters or animals.
Weapon_Shield_036_Caption: This extravagant shield is presented to Gerudo warriors who rise to the rank of captain. Its apparent opulence is rivaled only by its combat capabilities.
Weapon_Shield_037_Caption: This shield was cherished by the Gerudo Champion Urbosa. The gold used to make it was handpicked to ensure a design that is both lightweight and very durable.
Weapon_Shield_040_Caption: The lid of a large soup pot. It smells vaguely of poultry broth... Yum! It can take quite a beating before breaking.
Weapon_Shield_041_Caption: A small Sheikah-made shield. Its design is intended to decrease blind spots without sacrificing too much defense.
Weapon_Shield_042_Caption: Rito warriors cherish this shield. Its unique shape is designed with midbattle flight in mind to facilitate aerial combat.
Weapon_Shield_057_Caption: A shield said to have been the favorite of a hero who traveled the open seas. It was apparently a family heirloom, passed down through many generations.
Weapon_Shield_101_Caption: A shield used by Zonai and made of zonaite. It lowers the energy consumption of an attached Zonai device.
Weapon_Shield_102_Caption: A shield used by Zonai and made of zonaite. It is moderately durable and lowers the energy consumption of an attached Zonai device.
Weapon_Shield_103_Caption: A shield used by Zonai and made of zonaite. It is very durable and draws on its stored energy to more efficiently use an attached Zonai device.
Weapon_Shield_107_Caption: An aged, worn-out wooden shield. It can withstand lighter attacks, such as arrows.
Weapon_Spear_001_Caption: A spear used mainly by travelers to fend off wolves and other beasts. It's easy to hold and simple to use.
Weapon_Spear_002_Caption: A long spear once used by the guards of Hyrule Castle. Easy to use but difficult to master. Enables quicker charged attacks.
Weapon_Spear_003_Caption: A spear used by knights adept in mounted combat. The spearhead is modeled after an axe. It can yield powerful attacks when you're down to your last heart.
Weapon_Spear_021_Caption: A rusty polearm likely used by knights from an age past. The spearhead is in bad shape due to prolonged exposure to the elements, so its durability is low.
Weapon_Spear_022_Caption: A farming tool used to collect hay efficiently. It's light enough to be used by anyone. The four prongs are very sharp.
Weapon_Spear_024_Caption: This spear was issued to the knights who guarded Hyrule Castle's throne room. It yields a powerful flurry rush during a perfect dodge.
Weapon_Spear_025_Caption: The Koroks made this spear for Hylians. The shaft is made from a light, sturdy wood. Bursting materials attached to the spearhead can be reused again and again.
Weapon_Spear_027_Caption: This spear is a Zora's weapon of choice. It's made from a special metal and is used by the Zora for both fishing and protecting home. It yields high attack power when it gets wet.
Weapon_Spear_029_Caption: This spear was used widely by the Gerudo soldiers. Attaching a material greatly enhances the material's power but doesn't add as much durability.
Weapon_Spear_030_Caption: A specialized spear weighted to excel as a throwing weapon. It's perfectly balanced to be thrown farther than your average spear, able to pierce targets from a great distance.
Weapon_Spear_032_Caption: Its lightweight design is a hallmark of Rito craftsmanship. It gives Rito warriors more maneuverability during aerial combat—and it produces a strong wind.
Weapon_Spear_036_Caption: Just a mop to the untrained eye, it excels at tidying up the place. But it owes its sturdy construction to a true craftsman, so it actually has some combat merit.
Weapon_Spear_038_Caption: A fisherman's tool that excels at catching large fish. Its particularly sharp spearhead makes it valuable as a weapon as well.
Weapon_Spear_047_Caption: This Sheikah-made spear was created using ancient technology. It has poor durability, but the magic it contains yields massive destructive power just before it breaks.
Weapon_Spear_050_Caption: A spear of peerless grace cherished by the Zora Champion Mipha. Although Mipha specialized in healing abilities, her spearmanship was in a class all its own.
Weapon_Spear_101_Caption: A Zonai spear made of zonaite. It resonates with attached Zonai devices to slightly increase its attack power.
Weapon_Spear_103_Caption: A long stick fashioned from a tree branch. Its straight shape makes it work well as a lunging weapon.
Weapon_Spear_106_Caption: An average spear carried by travelers for protection. It's decayed and doesn't cut well, but the shape makes it easy for anyone to handle.
Weapon_Spear_108_Caption: A long, durable stick made from a branch with good piercing power. It has high durability because it comes from the hardest part of the tree.
Weapon_Spear_109_Caption: A long stick made bumpy at one end when its shoots were cut off. It has higher attack power than a normal stick.
Weapon_Spear_112_Caption: Although now decayed, this lightweight metal spear was made for royal soldiers. Because it's light and easy to handle, it enables quicker charged attacks.
Weapon_Spear_113_Caption: Now decayed, this halberd was made for knights of Hyrule. It reflects their courage in defending the kingdom. It can yield powerful attacks when you're down to your last heart.
Weapon_Spear_124_Caption: Although now decayed, this spear was once given to knights who guarded critical areas of Hyrule Castle. It enables a powerful flurry rush during a perfect dodge.
Weapon_Spear_125_Caption: A Korok spear with a decayed tip. It's still full of vitality. Bursting materials attached to the spearhead can be reused again and again.
Weapon_Spear_127_Caption: A Zora spear with a decayed point. It's made of a water-resistant metal and yields a high attack power when it gets wet.
Weapon_Spear_129_Caption: A Gerudo spear with a decayed blade that is designed to draw force to its tip. Attaching a material greatly enhances the material's power but doesn't add as much durability.
Weapon_Spear_132_Caption: A spear used by Rito soldiers, its point is now decayed. It still boasts quick attacks in midair, and it produces a strong wind.
Weapon_Spear_147_Caption: A prototype spear wielded by knights. It's made from a special metal with low durability, but which yields massive destructive power just before it breaks.
Weapon_Spear_161_Caption: A long rod with a bit of magic, it's said to have been wielded by an ancient magician who awoke the latent power of gems.
Weapon_Spear_163_Caption: A tough spear used by the Zonai. It is highly durable. It resonates with attached Zonai devices to increase some of its attack power.
Weapon_Spear_164_Caption: A powerful Zonai spear made of zonaite. It resonates with attached Zonai devices to greatly increase its attack power.
Weapon_Spear_166_Caption: A spear whose ominous appearance strikes fear into hearts. It is said to cost its bearer a part of their soul because its gloom will gradually wear down the body of its wielder.
Weapon_Spear_168_Caption: A long stick fashioned from a tree branch. Its straight shape makes it work well as a lunging weapon.
Weapon_Spear_173_Caption: A spear for throwing with a decayed tip. Lost its sharpness, but kept the balance perfect for throwing, enabling you to throw it very far.
Weapon_Sword_001_Caption: A very common sword often kept by travelers to fend off small beasts. It's fairly durable but a bit unreliable against monsters.
Weapon_Sword_002_Caption: A sword brandished by soldiers who once protected Hyrule Castle. Its blade is well tuned for slaying monsters as it enables quicker charged attacks.
Weapon_Sword_003_Caption: Knights of Hyrule Castle once carried this sword. It can yield powerful attacks when you're down to your last heart.
Weapon_Sword_019_Caption: A skeletal arm that keeps moving even after it’s severed from its body. It's kind of gross to strap it to your back, but it'll do in a pinch. It's old and fragile, so it's quick to break.
Weapon_Sword_020_Caption: The arm of a Stalizalfos that continues to struggle even in death. It can be used as a weapon, but it's very brittle. You can feel it wiggling when you strap it to your back...
Weapon_Sword_021_Caption: This once-fearsome sword has seen better days. It can do some damage in the right hands but also breaks quickly.
Weapon_Sword_022_Caption: A kitchen implement often used for serving delicious soups. It was carved from the wood of a sturdy tree, so it actually packs quite the wallop.
Weapon_Sword_024_Caption: The Hyrulean royal family would award this sword to knights who achieved remarkable feats. It increases the power of flurry rush during a perfect dodge.
Weapon_Sword_025_Caption: Koroks crafted this wooden sword for Hylians. It might not be the best choice for head-on attacks, but bursting materials attached to the tip can be reused again and again.
Weapon_Sword_027_Caption: A unique sword with a thin blade of Zora design that yields high attack power when wet. This blade takes to water like a Zora.
Weapon_Sword_029_Caption: The most commonly used sword in the Gerudo region. Attaching a material greatly enhances the material's power but doesn't add as much durability.
Weapon_Sword_031_Caption: Rito craftsmen forged this lightweight, double- edged sword so Rito warriors could maneuver quickly in midair. Swinging it produces a strong wind.
Weapon_Sword_041_Caption: A single-edged sword traditional to the Sheikah tribe. It just may be among the sharpest conventional weapons ever made. It can yield more powerful sneakstrikes.
Weapon_Sword_043_Caption: This torch will stay lit once ignited, but if you put it away, the flame will be extinguished until you light it again.
Weapon_Sword_044_Caption: Wooden branches such as this are pretty common, but it's surprisingly well-balanced. It doesn't do much damage but can serve as a weapon in a pinch.
Weapon_Sword_047_Caption: A weapon made by the Sheikah using ancient technology. Its low durability is a downside, but it yields massive destructive power just before it breaks.
Weapon_Sword_051_Caption: This throwing weapon was originally used by the forest-dwelling Koroks. Its unique shape allows it to return after being thrown.
Weapon_Sword_052_Caption: A famous sword once beloved by the Gerudo Champion Urbosa. It is said that when Urbosa swung this sword in battle, her movements resembled a beautiful dance.
Weapon_Sword_057_Caption: A sword said to have once belonged to a hero from the sky. Its beautiful white blade stands out. When it's wielded, a strange yet heavenly breeze kicks up around you.
Weapon_Sword_058_Caption: A sword once wielded by a hero in an ancient age. When it's grasped, a strange sense of nostalgia washes over you. Take it when going alone would otherwise be dangerous.
Weapon_Sword_059_Caption: A boomerang said to have been used by a hero who traveled the Great Sea. It smells faintly of salt water.
Weapon_Sword_070_Broken_Caption: The sword that seals the darkness. Its sacred power has been diminished after being ravaged by the gloom beneath Hyrule Castle.
Weapon_Sword_070_Broken_Caption_Broken: The sword that seals the darkness. Its sacred power has been diminished after being ravaged by the gloom beneath Hyrule Castle. It is now dormant and deep in slumber.
Weapon_Sword_070_Caption: The legendary sword that seals the darkness. Its corruption was healed by its time with the Light Dragon. The blade gleams with a sacred luster that can oppose the Demon King.
Weapon_Sword_101_Caption: A Zonai sword made of zonaite. It resonates with attached Zonai devices to slightly increase its attack power.
Weapon_Sword_103_Caption: A tree branch with an added grip and excellent balance. Equip it, and use it as a weapon.
Weapon_Sword_105_Caption: A decayed wooden boomerang. A useful tool that comes back after you throw it. Its current state has not lessened its performance.
Weapon_Sword_106_Caption: An average sword used largely by travelers. The blade has decayed, but it can still serve its purpose.
Weapon_Sword_107_Caption: A curved sword favored by the Lizalfos. It's made of metal so it can safely be used near fire. If you throw it, it will return to you.
Weapon_Sword_108_Caption: A stick made out of a hard tree branch. The tree soaked up lots of sunshine, so it's sturdier than a regular stick and has high durability.
Weapon_Sword_109_Caption: A very swingable stick made by honing a dried branch to the proper thickness and length. Its attack power is much greater than that of a normal stick.
Weapon_Sword_112_Caption: A light, thin metal sword used by the guards of Hyrule Castle. Its light weight makes it easy to handle and enables quicker charged attacks.
Weapon_Sword_113_Caption: Knights of Hyrule once carried this sword. Even in its decayed state, it shows its true resolve in desperation and can yield powerful attacks when you're down to your last heart.
Weapon_Sword_114_Caption: A single-edged sword of the Sheikah tribe.  Its small blade, now decayed, is suited for covert actions and yields more powerful sneakstrikes than ordinary blades.
Weapon_Sword_124_Caption: A sword gifted to accomplished knights by the royal family. Crafted for sword masters, it increases the power of flurry rush during perfect dodge.
Weapon_Sword_125_Caption: A living, wooden Korok sword with a decayed blade. Bursting materials attached to the tip can be reused again and again.
Weapon_Sword_127_Caption: A long Zora sword with a decaying blade. Made of a metal favored by the Zora, it yields a high attack power when it gets wet.
Weapon_Sword_129_Caption: A decaying scimitar from the Gerudo region, it is designed for maximizing force. Attaching a material greatly enhances the material's power but doesn't add as much durability.
Weapon_Sword_131_Caption: A double-edged Rito sword with a decayed blade. Swinging it produces a strong wind.
Weapon_Sword_147_Caption: A prototypical sword for knights. Its metal may not be as durable as others, but the sword yields massive destructive power just before it breaks.
Weapon_Sword_161_Caption: A small and intensely magic rod, it's said to have been wielded by an ancient magician who awoke maximum latent power in gems.
Weapon_Sword_163_Caption: A strong Zonai sword made of zonaite. It resonates with attached Zonai devices to increase some of its attack power.
Weapon_Sword_164_Caption: A powerful sword used by Zonai and made of zonaite. It resonates with attached Zonai devices to greatly increase its attack power.
Weapon_Sword_166_Caption: This slender sword has an ominous presence. It is said to end the life of anyone it touches. Its gloom will gradually wear down the body of its wielder.
Weapon_Sword_167_Caption: Wooden branches such as this are pretty common, but it's surprisingly well-balanced. It doesn't do much damage but can serve as a weapon in a pinch.
Weapon_Sword_168_Caption: A tree branch with an added grip and excellent balance. Equip it, and use it as a weapon.
Nickname_MiddleBoss_Goron: Rising from the Death Mountain Crater
Nickname_ShrineGolems: Guardians of the Shrine of Light
Nickname_SkyIsland_HateruSouth: Guardian of South Necluda Sky Archipelago
Nickname_Army_TribuneCave: Occupiers of the Foothill Monster Den
Nickname_Army_Ganondorf: War in the Depths of Hyrule
Nickname_SkyIsland_HebraWest: Guardian of West Hebra Sky Archipelago
Nickname_LargeDungeonSoul: The Vessel of Spirit's Resting Place
Nickname_FirstSkyIsland_BlockMaster: Guardian of the Great Sky Island
Nickname_SkyIsland_HyruleNorth: Guardian of North Hyrule Sky Archipelago
Nickname_Rito_SkyHighIsland: Guardian of the Rising Island Chain
Nickname_SkyIsland_HyruleWest: Guardian of South Hyrule Sky Archipelago
Nickname_SkyIsland_AkkareEast: Guardian of North Akkala Sky Archipelago
Nickname_LargeDungeonThunder: The Mural's Myth, Risen from the Sands
Nickname_SkyIsland_HyruleWestCentral: Guardian of West Hyrule Sky Archipelago
